definition: many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: The red fox's resourcefulness has earned it a legendary reputation for intelligence and cunning.
sentences.chinese: 赤狐的聰明狡猾足智多謀使它譽滿四海。

sentences.english: He performed outstanding military exploits and became famous as the resourceful one-eyed general.
sentences.chinese: 屢建戰功，以足智多謀的“獨目將軍”聞名於世。

sentences.english: In this movie,I like Jack,he is a resourceful man.
sentences.chinese: 電影裏，我比較喜歡傑克，他足智多謀。

sentences.english: This won't be an easy eclipse, but you are flexible and resourceful.
sentences.chinese: 這不會是一樣容易的月蝕，但你是靈活和足智多謀的。

sentences.english: The military counselor Wu Yong in the novel "Water Margins"is a man of ingenuity.
sentences.chinese: 小說《水滸》中的吳用在軍事上足智多謀。

sentences.english: I find that I am resourceful.
sentences.chinese: 我發現我變的足智多謀了。

sentences.english: Liu Bocheng is world-renowned as a resourceful(heads-up) one-eyed general.
sentences.chinese: 劉伯承以足智多謀的“獨目將軍”聞名於世。

sentences.english: He's an old man who is intelligent and resourceful.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位足智多謀的老叟。

sentences.english: Liu Bocheng became famous as the resourceful one-eyed general.
sentences.chinese: 劉伯承以足智多謀的“獨目將軍”聞名於世。

sentences.english: The resourceful jurist formed a plan to recover his own laurels .
sentences.chinese: 足智多謀的法學家已經想出了一個恢復名譽的計策。

sentences.english: Our enemies are innovative and resourceful, and so are we.
sentences.chinese: 我們的敵人具有創新性，足智多謀，我們也是。

sentences.english: Our enemies are innovative and resourceful, and so are we.
sentences.chinese: 我們的敵人足智多謀，我們也如此。

sentences.english: Kagome is also a remarkably resourceful girl.
sentences.chinese: 戈薇也是一位足智多謀的女孩。

sentences.english: His ingenuity with words stamped his as an outstanding politician.
sentences.chinese: 他那足智多謀的話語說明他是一位傑出的政治家。

sentences.english: Tom: In this movie,I like Jack,he is a resourceful man.
sentences.chinese: 電影裏，我比較喜歡傑克，他足智多謀。

sentences.english: He marveled sometimes at the man's resourcefulness.
sentences.chinese: 他有時對於這個人的足智多謀感到喫驚。

definition: to be brave and good at fighting (idiom)
to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
first Sui emperor (541-604) Yang Jian (541-604), reigned 581-604
to charge and break through enemy lines
full of political wisdom (idiom)/politically astute/with encyclopedic experience of state policy
standing above the common crowd (idiom); outstanding/excellent and unrivaled
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
